verses.text: Woe to Ariel , to Ariel , the city \add where\add* David dwelt ! add ye year to year ; let them kill sacrifices.\f + \fr 29.1 \ft Woe…: or, O Ariel, that is, the lion of God\f*\f + \fr 29.1 \ft the city: or, of the city\f*\f + \fr 29.1 \ft kill: Heb. cut off the heads of\f*
Yet I will distress Ariel , and there shall be heaviness and sorrow : and it shall be unto me as Ariel.
And I will camp against thee round about , and will lay siege against thee with a mount , and I will raise forts against thee.

And thou shalt be brought down , \add and\add* shalt speak out of the ground , and thy speech shall be low out of the dust , and thy voice shall be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit , out of the ground , and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.\f + \fr 29.4 \ft whisper: Heb. peep, or, chirp\f*
Moreover the multitude of thy strangers shall be like small dust , and the multitude of the terrible ones \add shall be\add* as chaff that passeth away : yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly.
Thou shalt be visited of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts with thunder , and with earthquake , and great noise , with storm and tempest , and the flame of devouring fire. \p
¶ And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel , even all that fight against her and her munition , and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision.

It shall even be as when an hungry \add man\add* dreameth , and, behold, he eateth ; but he awaketh , and his soul is empty : or as when a thirsty man dreameth , and, behold, he drinketh ; but he awaketh , and, behold, \add he is\add* faint , and his soul hath appetite : so shall the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against mount Zion. \p
¶ Stay yourselves, and wonder ; cry ye out , and cry : they are drunken , but not with wine ; they stagger , but not with strong drink.\f + \fr 29.9 \ft cry ye…: or, take your pleasure, and riot\f*

For the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep , and hath closed your eyes : the prophets and your rulers , the seers hath he covered.\f + \fr 29.10 \ft rulers: Heb. heads\f*

And the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book that is sealed , which \add men\add* deliver to one that is learned , saying , Read this, I pray thee: and he saith , I cannot ; for it \add is\add* sealed :\f + \fr 29.11 \ft book: or, letter\f*
And the book is delivered to him that is not learned , saying , Read this, I pray thee: and he saith , I am not learned. \p

¶ Wherefore the Lord said , Forasmuch as this people draw near \add me\add* with their mouth , and with their lips do honour me, but have removed their heart far from me, and their fear toward me is taught by the precept of men :

Therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvellous work among this people , \add even\add* a marvellous work and a wonder : for the wisdom of their wise \add men\add* shall perish , and the understanding of their prudent \add men\add* shall be hid.\f + \fr 29.14 \ft proceed: Heb. add\f*
Woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and their works are in the dark , and they say , Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?

Surely your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the potter’s clay : for shall the work say of him that made it, He made me not? or shall the thing framed say of him that framed it, He had no understanding ? \p
\add Is\add* it not yet a very little while , and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field , and the fruitful field shall be esteemed as a forest ? \p
¶ And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book , and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity , and out of darkness.
The meek also shall increase \add their\add* joy in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.\f + \fr 29.19 \ft increase: Heb. add\f*
For the terrible one is brought to nought , and the scorner is consumed , and all that watch for iniquity are cut off :
That make a man an offender for a word , and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate , and turn aside the just for a thing of nought.
Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, who redeemed Abraham , concerning the house of Jacob , Jacob shall not now be ashamed , neither shall his face now wax pale.
But when he seeth his children , the work of mine hands , in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name , and sanctify the Holy One of Jacob , and shall fear the God of Israel.
They also that erred in spirit shall come to understanding , and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.\f + \fr 29.24 \ft come…: Heb. know understanding\f*
